src/core/clients.py::BaseLLMClient.name: BaseLLMClient
src/core/clients.py::BaseLLMClient.intent: Base class for LLM clients, handling common request logic for Chat APIs.
src/core/clients.py::BaseLLMClient.docstring:
Base class for LLM clients, handling common request logic for Chat APIs.
Provides shared initialization and error handling for all LLM clients.

src/core/clients.py::__init__.name: __init__
src/core/clients.py::__init__.intent: Initializes the GeneratorClient using the central settings object.
src/core/clients.py::__init__.docstring: Initializes the GeneratorClient using the central settings object.

src/core/clients.py::make_request.name: make_request
src/core/clients.py::make_request.intent: Sends a prompt to the configured Chat Completions API.
src/core/clients.py::make_request.docstring:
Sends a prompt to the configured Chat Completions API.

Args:
    prompt (str): The prompt to send to the LLM. It will be wrapped as a
        'user' message.
    user_id (str): Optional identifier for the requester (used by some APIs
        for moderation).

Returns:
    str: The text content from the LLM's response, or an error message.

Raises:
    requests.HTTPError: If the API returns a non-200 status code.

src/core/clients.py::OrchestratorClient.name: OrchestratorClient
src/core/clients.py::OrchestratorClient.intent: Client for the Orchestrator LLM (e.g., GPT-4, Claude 3).
src/core/clients.py::OrchestratorClient.docstring:
Client for the Orchestrator LLM (e.g., GPT-4, Claude 3).
Responsible for high-level planning and intent interpretation.

src/core/clients.py::GeneratorClient.name: GeneratorClient
src/core/clients.py::GeneratorClient.intent: Client for the Generator LLM (e.g., a specialized coding model).
src/core/clients.py::GeneratorClient.docstring:
Client for the Generator LLM (e.g., a specialized coding model).
Responsible for code generation and detailed implementation.

src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_load_s.name: _load_safety_policies
src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_load_s.intent: Loads and caches the safety policies from the .intent directory.
src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_load_s.docstring: Loads and caches the safety policies from the .intent directory.

src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_get_fu.name: _get_full_attribute_name
src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_get_fu.intent: Recursively builds the full name of an attribute call (e.g., 'os.path.join').
src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_get_fu.docstring: Recursively builds the full name of an attribute call (e.g., 'os.path.join').

src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_find_d.name: _find_dangerous_patterns
src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_find_d.intent: Scans the AST for calls and imports forbidden by safety policies.
src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_find_d.docstring: Scans the AST for calls and imports forbidden by safety policies.

src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_check_.name: _check_for_todo_comments
src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_check_.intent: Scans source code for TODO/FIXME comments and returns them as violations.
src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_check_.docstring: Scans source code for TODO/FIXME comments and returns them as violations.

src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_check_.name: _check_semantics
src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_check_.intent: Runs all policy-aware semantic checks on a string of Python code.
src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_check_.docstring: Runs all policy-aware semantic checks on a string of Python code.

src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_valida.name: _validate_python_code
src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_valida.intent: Internal pipeline for Python code validation.
src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_valida.docstring:
Internal pipeline for Python code validation.
Returns the final code and a list of all found violations.

src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_get_fi.name: _get_file_classification
src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_get_fi.intent: Determines the file type based on its extension.
src/core/validation_pipeline.py::_get_fi.docstring: Determines the file type based on its extension.

src/core/validation_pipeline.py::validat.name: validate_code
src/core/validation_pipeline.py::validat.intent: The main entry point for validation. It determines the file type
src/core/validation_pipeline.py::validat.docstring:
The main entry point for validation. It determines the file type
and routes it to the appropriate validation pipeline, returning a
standardized dictionary.

src/core/git_service.py::GitService.name: GitService
src/core/git_service.py::GitService.intent: Encapsulates Git operations for the CORE system.
src/core/git_service.py::GitService.docstring:
Encapsulates Git operations for the CORE system.
Ensures all file changes are committed with traceable messages.

src/core/git_service.py::__init__.name: __init__
src/core/git_service.py::__init__.docstring:
Initialize GitService with repository root.

Args:
    repo_path (str): Path to the Git repository.

src/core/git_service.py::_run_command.name: _run_command
src/core/git_service.py::_run_command.intent: Run a Git command and return stdout.
src/core/git_service.py::_run_command.docstring:
Run a Git command and return stdout.

Args:
    command (list): Git command as a list (e.g., ['git', 'status']).

Returns:
    str: Command output, or raises RuntimeError on failure.

src/core/git_service.py::add.name: add
src/core/git_service.py::add.intent: Stage a file or directory for commit.
src/core/git_service.py::add.docstring:
Stage a file or directory for commit.

Args:
    file_path (str): Path to stage. Defaults to '.' (all changes).

src/core/git_service.py::commit.name: commit
src/core/git_service.py::commit.intent: Commit staged changes with a message.
src/core/git_service.py::commit.docstring:
Commit staged changes with a message.
If there are no changes to commit, this operation is a no-op and will not raise an error.

Args:
    message (str): Commit message explaining the change.

src/core/git_service.py::is_git_repo.name: is_git_repo
src/core/git_service.py::is_git_repo.intent: Check if the configured path is a valid Git repository.
src/core/git_service.py::is_git_repo.docstring:
Check if the configured path is a valid Git repository.

Returns:
    bool: True if it's a Git repo, False otherwise.

src/core/git_service.py::get_current_com.name: get_current_commit
src/core/git_service.py::get_current_com.intent: Gets the full SHA hash of the current commit (HEAD).
src/core/git_service.py::get_current_com.docstring: Gets the full SHA hash of the current commit (HEAD).

src/core/git_service.py::reset_to_commit.name: reset_to_commit
src/core/git_service.py::reset_to_commit.intent: Performs a hard reset to a specific commit hash.
src/core/git_service.py::reset_to_commit.docstring:
Performs a hard reset to a specific commit hash.
This will discard all current changes.

src/core/syntax_checker.py::check_syntax.name: check_syntax
src/core/syntax_checker.py::check_syntax.intent: Checks whether the given code has valid Python syntax.
src/core/syntax_checker.py::check_syntax.docstring:
Checks whether the given code has valid Python syntax.

Args:
    file_path (str): File name (used to detect .py files).
    code (str): Source code string.

Returns:
    A list of violation dictionaries. An empty list means the syntax is valid.

src/core/black_formatter.py::format_code.name: format_code_with_black
src/core/black_formatter.py::format_code.intent: Attempts to format the given Python code using Black.
src/core/black_formatter.py::format_code.docstring:
Attempts to format the given Python code using Black.

Args:
    code: The Python source code to format.

Returns:
    The formatted code as a string.

Raises:
    black.InvalidInput: If the code contains a syntax error that Black cannot handle.
    Exception: For other unexpected Black formatting errors.

src/core/test_runner.py::run_tests.name: run_tests
src/core/test_runner.py::run_tests.intent: Executes pytest on the tests/ directory and returns a structured result.
src/core/test_runner.py::run_tests.docstring:
Executes pytest on the tests/ directory and returns a structured result.
This function captures stdout, stderr, and the exit code, providing a
comprehensive summary of the test run for agents to act upon.

src/core/test_runner.py::_summarize.name: _summarize
src/core/test_runner.py::_summarize.intent: Parses pytest output to find the final summary line.
src/core/test_runner.py::_summarize.docstring: Parses pytest output to find the final summary line.

src/core/test_runner.py::_log_test_resul.name: _log_test_result
src/core/test_runner.py::_log_test_resul.intent: Appends a JSON record of a test run to the persistent log file.
src/core/test_runner.py::_log_test_resul.docstring: Appends a JSON record of a test run to the persistent log file.

src/core/test_runner.py::_store_failure_.name: _store_failure_if_any
src/core/test_runner.py::_store_failure_.intent: Saves the details of a failed test run to a dedicated file for easy access.
src/core/test_runner.py::_store_failure_.docstring: Saves the details of a failed test run to a dedicated file for easy access.

src/core/main.py::lifespan.name: lifespan
src/core/main.py::lifespan.intent: FastAPI lifespan handler — runs startup and shutdown logic.
src/core/main.py::lifespan.docstring: FastAPI lifespan handler — runs startup and shutdown logic.

src/core/main.py::GoalRequest.name: GoalRequest
src/core/main.py::GoalRequest.intent: Defines the request body for the /execute_goal endpoint.
src/core/main.py::GoalRequest.docstring: Defines the request body for the /execute_goal endpoint.

src/core/main.py::execute_goal.name: execute_goal
src/core/main.py::execute_goal.intent: Execute a high-level goal by planning and generating code.
src/core/main.py::execute_goal.docstring: Execute a high-level goal by planning and generating code.

src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::PromptPipel.name: PromptPipeline
src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::PromptPipel.intent: Processes and enriches user prompts by resolving directives like [[include:...]] and [[analysis:...]].
src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::PromptPipel.docstring:
Processes and enriches user prompts by resolving directives like [[include:...]] and [[analysis:...]].
Ensures the LLM receives full context before generating code.

src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::__init__.name: __init__
src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::__init__.docstring:
Initialize PromptPipeline with repository root.

Args:
    repo_path (Path): Root path of the repository.

src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::_replace_co.name: _replace_context_match
src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::_replace_co.intent: Dynamically replaces a [[context:...]] regex match with file content or an error message.
src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::_replace_co.docstring: Dynamically replaces a [[context:...]] regex match with file content or an error message.

src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::_inject_con.name: _inject_context
src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::_inject_con.intent: Replaces [[context:file.py]] directives with actual file content.
src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::_inject_con.docstring: Replaces [[context:file.py]] directives with actual file content.

src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::_replace_in.name: _replace_include_match
src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::_replace_in.intent: Dynamically replaces an [[include:...]] regex match with file content or an error message.
src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::_replace_in.docstring: Dynamically replaces an [[include:...]] regex match with file content or an error message.

src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::_replace_an.name: _replace_analysis_match
src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::_replace_an.intent: Dynamically replaces an [[analysis:...]] regex match with a placeholder analysis message.
src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::_replace_an.docstring: Dynamically replaces an [[analysis:...]] regex match with a placeholder analysis message.

src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::_replace_ma.name: _replace_manifest_match
src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::_replace_ma.intent: Dynamically replaces a [[manifest:...]] regex match with manifest data or an error.
src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::_replace_ma.docstring: Dynamically replaces a [[manifest:...]] regex match with manifest data or an error.

src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::_inject_man.name: _inject_manifest
src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::_inject_man.intent: Replaces [[manifest:field]] directives with data from project_manifest.yaml.
src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::_inject_man.docstring: Replaces [[manifest:field]] directives with data from project_manifest.yaml.

src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::process.name: process
src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::process.intent: Processes the full prompt by sequentially resolving all directives.
src/core/prompt_pipeline.py::process.docstring:
Processes the full prompt by sequentially resolving all directives.
This is the main entry point for prompt enrichment.

src/core/capabilities.py::introspection.name: introspection
src/core/capabilities.py::introspection.intent: Runs a full self-analysis cycle to inspect system structure and health.
src/core/capabilities.py::introspection.docstring:
Runs a full self-analysis cycle to inspect system structure and health.
This orchestrates the execution of the system's own introspection tools
as separate, governed processes.

src/core/ruff_linter.py::fix_and_lint_co.name: fix_and_lint_code_with_ruff
src/core/ruff_linter.py::fix_and_lint_co.intent: Fix and lint the provided Python code using Ruff's JSON output format.
src/core/ruff_linter.py::fix_and_lint_co.docstring:
Fix and lint the provided Python code using Ruff's JSON output format.

Args:
    code (str): Source code to fix and lint.
    display_filename (str): Optional display name for readable error messages.

Returns:
    A tuple containing:
    - The potentially fixed code as a string.
    - A list of structured violation dictionaries for any remaining issues.

src/core/file_handler.py::FileHandler.name: FileHandler
src/core/file_handler.py::FileHandler.intent: Central class for safe, auditable file operations in CORE.
src/core/file_handler.py::FileHandler.docstring:
Central class for safe, auditable file operations in CORE.
All writes are staged first and require confirmation. Validation is handled
by the calling agent via the validation_pipeline.

src/core/file_handler.py::add_pending_wr.name: add_pending_write
src/core/file_handler.py::add_pending_wr.intent: Stages a pending write operation for later confirmation.
src/core/file_handler.py::add_pending_wr.docstring: Stages a pending write operation for later confirmation.

src/core/file_handler.py::confirm_write.name: confirm_write
src/core/file_handler.py::confirm_write.intent: Confirms and applies a pending write to disk. Assumes content has been validated.
src/core/file_handler.py::confirm_write.docstring: Confirms and applies a pending write to disk. Assumes content has been validated.

src/core/intent_model.py::IntentModel.name: IntentModel
src/core/intent_model.py::IntentModel.intent: Loads and provides an queryable interface to the source code structure
src/core/intent_model.py::IntentModel.docstring:
Loads and provides an queryable interface to the source code structure
defined in .intent/knowledge/source_structure.yaml.

src/core/intent_model.py::__init__.name: __init__
src/core/intent_model.py::__init__.intent: Initializes the model by loading the source structure definition.
src/core/intent_model.py::__init__.docstring:
Initializes the model by loading the source structure definition.

Args:
    repo_root (Optional[Path]): The root of the repository. Inferred if not provided.

src/core/intent_model.py::_load_structur.name: _load_structure
src/core/intent_model.py::_load_structur.docstring:
Load the domain structure from .intent/knowledge/source_structure.yaml.

Returns:
    Dict[str, dict]: Mapping of domain names to metadata (path, permissions, etc.).

src/core/intent_model.py::resolve_domain.name: resolve_domain_for_path
src/core/intent_model.py::resolve_domain.intent: Given an absolute or relative path, determine which domain it belongs to.
src/core/intent_model.py::resolve_domain.docstring:
Given an absolute or relative path, determine which domain it belongs to.
Prefers deeper (more specific) paths over shorter ones.

src/core/intent_model.py::get_domain_per.name: get_domain_permissions
src/core/intent_model.py::get_domain_per.intent: Return a list of allowed domains that the given domain can import from.
src/core/intent_model.py::get_domain_per.docstring:
Return a list of allowed domains that the given domain can import from.

Args:
    domain (str): The domain to query.

Returns:
    List[str]: List of allowed domain names, or empty list if not defined.

src/core/intent_guard.py::IntentGuard.name: IntentGuard
src/core/intent_guard.py::IntentGuard.intent: Central enforcement engine for CORE's safety and governance policies.
src/core/intent_guard.py::IntentGuard.docstring:
Central enforcement engine for CORE's safety and governance policies.
Ensures all proposed file changes comply with declared rules and classifications.

src/core/intent_guard.py::__init__.name: __init__
src/core/intent_guard.py::__init__.intent: Initialize IntentGuard with repository path and load all policies.
src/core/intent_guard.py::__init__.docstring: Initialize IntentGuard with repository path and load all policies.

src/core/intent_guard.py::_load_policies.intent: Load rules from all YAML files in .intent/policies/.

src/core/intent_guard.py::_load_source_m.docstring: Load the list of all known source files from the knowledge graph.

src/core/intent_guard.py::check_transact.name: check_transaction
src/core/intent_guard.py::check_transact.intent: Check if a proposed set of file changes complies with all active rules.
src/core/intent_guard.py::check_transact.docstring:
Check if a proposed set of file changes complies with all active rules.
This is the primary enforcement point for constitutional integrity.

The primary agent responsible for decomposing high-level goals into executable plans.

src/shared/path_utils.py::get_repo_root.name: get_repo_root

src/shared/path_utils.py::get_repo_root.docstring:
Find and return the repository root by locating the .git directory.
Starts from current directory or provided path.

    RuntimeError: If no .git directory is found.

src/shared/config_loader.py::load_config.name: load_config
src/shared/config_loader.py::load_config.intent: Loads a JSON or YAML file into a dictionary with consistent error handling.
src/shared/config_loader.py::load_config.docstring:
Loads a JSON or YAML file into a dictionary with consistent error handling.

Args:
    file_path (Path): Path to the file to load.
    file_type (str): 'json', 'yaml', or 'auto' to infer from extension.

Returns:
    Dict[str, Any]: Parsed file content or empty dict if file is missing/invalid.

src/system/guard/drift_detector.py::_nor.docstring:
Intent: Normalize different manifest shapes into a {capability: CapabilityMeta} map.
Looks for keys commonly used in CORE manifests:
  - capabilities
  - required_capabilities
  - expected_capabilities
  - capability_map / capability_registry
  - components[*].capabilities

src/system/tools/codegraph_builder.py::s.docstring: Scans a single Python file, parsing its AST to extract all symbols.

src/system/tools/codegraph_builder.py::_.name: _process_symbol_node
src/system/tools/codegraph_builder.py::_.intent: Extracts and stores metadata from a single function or class AST node.
src/system/tools/codegraph_builder.py::_.docstring: Extracts and stores metadata from a single function or class AST node.

src/system/tools/codegraph_builder.py::_.name: _apply_entry_point_patterns
src/system/tools/codegraph_builder.py::_.intent: Applies declarative patterns to identify non-obvious entry points.
src/system/tools/codegraph_builder.py::_.docstring: Applies declarative patterns to identify non-obvious entry points.

src/system/tools/codegraph_builder.py::b.name: build
src/system/tools/codegraph_builder.py::b.intent: Orchestrates the full knowledge graph generation process.
src/system/tools/codegraph_builder.py::b.docstring: Orchestrates the full knowledge graph generation process.

src/system/tools/codegraph_builder.py::m.name: main
src/system/tools/codegraph_builder.py::m.intent: CLI entry point to run the knowledge graph builder and save the output.
src/system/tools/codegraph_builder.py::m.docstring: CLI entry point to run the knowledge graph builder and save the output.

src/system/tools/manifest_migrator.py::m.name: migrate_manifest
src/system/tools/manifest_migrator.py::m.intent: Reads the monolithic manifest and splits it into per-domain manifests.
src/system/tools/manifest_migrator.py::m.docstring: Reads the monolithic manifest and splits it into per-domain manifests.

src/system/tools/docstring_adder.py::add.name: add_docstring_to_function_line_based
src/system/tools/docstring_adder.py::add.intent: Surgically inserts a docstring into source code using a line-based method.
src/system/tools/docstring_adder.py::add.docstring:
Surgically inserts a docstring into source code using a line-based method.
This is safer than AST unparsing as it preserves comments and formatting.

src/system/tools/docstring_adder.py::fix.name: fix_missing_docstrings
src/system/tools/docstring_adder.py::fix.intent: Finds all functions with missing docstrings and uses an LLM to generate them.
src/system/tools/docstring_adder.py::fix.docstring: Finds all functions with missing docstrings and uses an LLM to generate them.

src/system/governance/checks/quality_che.name: QualityChecks
src/system/governance/checks/quality_che.intent: Container for code quality constitutional checks.
src/system/governance/checks/quality_che.docstring: Container for code quality constitutional checks.

src/system/governance/checks/quality_che.name: __init__
src/system/governance/checks/quality_che.intent: Initializes the check with a shared auditor context.
src/system/governance/checks/quality_che.docstring: Initializes the check with a shared auditor context.

src/system/governance/checks/quality_che.name: check_docstrings_and_intents
src/system/governance/checks/quality_che.intent: Finds symbols missing docstrings or having generic intents.
src/system/governance/checks/quality_che.docstring: Finds symbols missing docstrings or having generic intents.

src/system/governance/checks/file_checks.name: __init__
src/system/governance/checks/file_checks.intent: Initializes the check with a shared auditor context.
src/system/governance/checks/file_checks.docstring: Initializes the check with a shared auditor context.

src/system/governance/checks/file_checks.name: check_required_files
src/system/governance/checks/file_checks.intent: Verifies that all files declared in meta.yaml exist on disk.
src/system/governance/checks/file_checks.docstring: Verifies that all files declared in meta.yaml exist on disk.

src/system/governance/checks/file_checks.name: check_syntax
src/system/governance/checks/file_checks.intent: Validates the syntax of all .intent YAML/JSON files (including proposals).
src/system/governance/checks/file_checks.docstring: Validates the syntax of all .intent YAML/JSON files (including proposals).

src/system/governance/checks/file_checks.name: check_for_orphaned_intent_files
src/system/governance/checks/file_checks.intent: Finds .intent files that are not referenced in meta.yaml.
src/system/governance/checks/file_checks.docstring: Finds .intent files that are not referenced in meta.yaml.

src/system/governance/checks/file_checks.name: _get_known_files_from_meta
src/system/governance/checks/file_checks.intent: Builds a set of all known intent files by reading .intent/meta.yaml.
src/system/governance/checks/file_checks.docstring: Builds a set of all known intent files by reading .intent/meta.yaml.

src/system/governance/checks/file_checks.name: _recursive_find_paths
src/system/governance/checks/file_checks.intent: Recursively finds all file paths declared in the meta configuration.
src/system/governance/checks/file_checks.docstring: Recursively finds all file paths declared in the meta configuration.

src/system/governance/checks/proposal_ch.intent: Initializes the check with a shared auditor context.
src/system/governance/checks/proposal_ch.docstring: Initializes the check with a shared auditor context.

src/system/governance/checks/proposal_ch.name: _proposal_paths
src/system/governance/checks/proposal_ch.intent: Return all cr-* proposals (both YAML and JSON).
src/system/governance/checks/proposal_ch.docstring: Return all cr-* proposals (both YAML and JSON).

src/system/governance/checks/proposal_ch.name: check_proposal_files_match_schema
src/system/governance/checks/proposal_ch.intent: Validate each cr-*.yaml/json proposal against proposal.schema.json.
src/system/governance/checks/proposal_ch.docstring: Validate each cr-*.yaml/json proposal against proposal.schema.json.

src/system/governance/checks/proposal_ch.name: check_signatures_match_content
src/system/governance/checks/proposal_ch.docstring:
Detect content/signature drift:
- warn if a proposal has no signatures
- warn if any signature token does not match the current content

src/system/governance/checks/proposal_ch.name: list_pending_proposals
src/system/governance/checks/proposal_ch.intent: Emit a friendly summary of pending proposals.
src/system/governance/checks/proposal_ch.docstring: Emit a friendly summary of pending proposals.

src/system/governance/checks/structure_c.name: __init__
src/system/governance/checks/structure_c.intent: Initializes the check with a shared auditor context.
src/system/governance/checks/structure_c.docstring: Initializes the check with a shared auditor context.

src/system/governance/checks/structure_c.name: check_capability_coverage
src/system/governance/checks/structure_c.intent: Ensures all required capabilities are implemented.
src/system/governance/checks/structure_c.docstring: Ensures all required capabilities are implemented.

src/system/governance/checks/structure_c.intent: Ensures all implemented capabilities are valid.
src/system/governance/checks/structure_c.docstring: Ensures all implemented capabilities are valid.

src/system/governance/checks/structure_c.docstring: Checks for domain mismatches and illegal imports.

src/system/governance/checks/environment.intent: Container for environment and runtime configuration checks.
src/system/governance/checks/environment.docstring: Container for environment and runtime configuration checks.

src/system/governance/checks/environment.name: __init__
src/system/governance/checks/environment.intent: Initializes the check with a shared auditor context.
src/system/governance/checks/environment.docstring: Initializes the check with a shared auditor context.

src/system/governance/checks/environment.name: check_runtime_environment
src/system/governance/checks/environment.intent: Verifies that required environment variables are set.
src/system/governance/checks/environment.docstring: Verifies that required environment variables are set.

src/core/cli/guard.py::_print_table.name: _print_table
src/core/cli/guard.py::_print_table.intent: Prints a formatted report of capability discrepancies (missing in code, undeclared in manifest, and mismatched mappings) from a dictionary.
src/core/cli/guard.py::_print_table.docstring: Prints a formatted report of capability discrepancies (missing in code, undeclared in manifest, and mismatched mappings) from a dictionary.

src/core/cli/guard.py::section.name: section
src/core/cli/guard.py::section.intent: Prints a formatted section with a title and a list of items, or '(none)' if the list is empty.
src/core/cli/guard.py::section.docstring: Prints a formatted section with a title and a list of items, or '(none)' if the list is empty.

src/core/cli/guard.py::_should_fail.name: _should_fail
src/core/cli/guard.py::_should_fail.intent: Determines whether to fail based on the report and specified condition (missing, undeclared, or any discrepancy).
src/core/cli/guard.py::_should_fail.docstring: Determines whether to fail based on the report and specified condition (missing, undeclared, or any discrepancy).

src/core/cli/guard.py::_handle_drift.name: _handle_drift
src/core/cli/guard.py::_handle_drift.intent: Processes capability drift detection, generates a report, and returns an exit code based on drift severity and fail conditions.
src/core/cli/guard.py::_handle_drift.docstring: Processes capability drift detection, generates a report, and returns an exit code based on drift severity and fail conditions.

src/core/cli/guard.py::register_guard_co.name: register_guard_command
src/core/cli/guard.py::register_guard_co.intent: Register the 'guard' command and its subcommands (including 'drift') with argparse subparsers.
src/core/cli/guard.py::register_guard_co.docstring: Register the 'guard' command and its subcommands (including 'drift') with argparse subparsers.

src/core/cli/guard.py::ensure_cli_entryp.name: ensure_cli_entrypoint
src/core/cli/guard.py::ensure_cli_entryp.intent: Initializes and executes the CLI entrypoint for core-admin, handling command registration and parsing.
src/core/cli/guard.py::ensure_cli_entryp.docstring: Initializes and executes the CLI entrypoint for core-admin, handling command registration and parsing.

src/shared/schemas/manifest_validator.py.name: load_schema
src/shared/schemas/manifest_validator.py.intent: Load a JSON schema from the .intent/schemas/ directory.
src/shared/schemas/manifest_validator.py.docstring:
Load a JSON schema from the .intent/schemas/ directory.

Args:
    schema_name (str): The filename of the schema (e.g., 'knowledge_graph_entry.schema.json').
    
Returns:
    Dict[str, Any]: The loaded JSON schema.
    
Raises:
    FileNotFoundError: If the schema file is not found.
    json.JSONDecodeError: If the schema file is not valid JSON.

src/shared/schemas/manifest_validator.py.name: validate_manifest_entry
src/shared/schemas/manifest_validator.py.intent: Validate a single manifest entry against a schema.
src/shared/schemas/manifest_validator.py.docstring:
Validate a single manifest entry against a schema.

Args:
    entry: The dictionary representing a single function/class entry.
    schema_name: The filename of the schema to validate against.
    
Returns:
    A tuple of (is_valid: bool, list_of_error_messages: List[str]).

src/shared/utils/manifest_aggregator.py:.name: aggregate_manifests
src/shared/utils/manifest_aggregator.py:.intent: Finds all domain-specific manifest.yaml files and merges them.
src/shared/utils/manifest_aggregator.py:.docstring:
Finds all domain-specific manifest.yaml files and merges them.

This function is the heart of the modular manifest system. It reads the
source structure to find all domains, then searches for a manifest in each
domain's directory, aggregating their contents.

Args:
    repo_root (Path): The absolute path to the repository root.

Returns:
    A dictionary representing the aggregated manifest, primarily focused
    on compiling a unified list of 'required_capabilities'.

src/shared/utils/import_scanner.py::scan.name: scan_imports_for_file
src/shared/utils/import_scanner.py::scan.intent: Parse a Python file and extract all imported module paths.
src/shared/utils/import_scanner.py::scan.docstring:
Parse a Python file and extract all imported module paths.

Args:
    file_path (Path): Path to the file.

Returns:
    List[str]: List of imported module paths.

src/shared/utils/parsing.py::parse_write.name: parse_write_blocks
src/shared/utils/parsing.py::parse_write.intent: Extracts all [[write:...]] blocks from LLM output.
src/shared/utils/parsing.py::parse_write.docstring:
Extracts all [[write:...]] blocks from LLM output.

This function is robust and handles both [[end]] and [[/write]] as valid terminators
to accommodate different LLM habits.

Args:
    llm_output (str): The raw text output from a language model.

Returns:
    A dictionary mapping file paths to their corresponding code content.
